## Description {#details}

This class holds information that describes a formula for computing satisfying a use.

It may include broken-out immediates and scaled registers.

Definition at line 475 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp">LoopStrengthReduce.cpp</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### canonicalize() {#aef242a2293780c65ed1974184bc17193}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void Formula::canonicalize (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &amp; L)</>}>
Helper method to morph a formula into its canonical representation.

<SectionUser title="See Also">
<a href="#ad1246f472c53ef21f95da9e3f6b3f3c2">Formula::BaseRegs</a>. Every formula having more than one base register, must <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/localizer-cpp/#a428090a453f41a199ef67fc3f2179fbc">use</a> the <a href="#a10f8f397229c512b481d8067dc0111db">ScaledReg</a> field. Otherwise, we would have to do special cases everywhere in LSR to treat reg1 + reg2 + ... the same way as reg1 + 1&#42;reg2 + ... On the other hand, 1&#42;reg should be canonicalized into reg.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp/#l00519">519</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp">LoopStrengthReduce.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### unscale() {#ad02fff210996fa6f08b890aabf0f10ca}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool Formula::unscale ()">
Get rid of the scale in the formula.

In other words, this method morphes reg1 + 1&#42;reg2 into reg1 + reg2. 
<SectionUser title="Returns">
true if it was possible to get rid of the scale, false otherwise.
</SectionUser>


:::info
After this operation the formula may not be in the canonical form.
:::

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp/#l00521">521</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp">LoopStrengthReduce.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp/#l00480">480</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp">LoopStrengthReduce.cpp</a>.

### BaseRegs {#ad1246f472c53ef21f95da9e3f6b3f3c2}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>SmallVector&lt;const SCEV &#42;, 4&gt; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LoopStrengthReduce.cpp&#125;::Formula::BaseRegs</>}>
The list of &quot;base&quot; registers for this use.

When this is non-empty. The canonical representation of a formula is
<ul>
<li>BaseRegs.size &gt; 1 implies ScaledReg != NULL and</li>
<li>ScaledReg != NULL implies Scale != 1 || !BaseRegs.empty().</li>
<li>The reg containing recurrent expr related with currect loop in the formula should be put in the ScaledReg. #1 enforces that the scaled register is always used when at least two registers are needed by the formula: e.g., reg1 + reg2 is reg1 + 1 &#42; reg2. #2 enforces that 1 &#42; reg is reg. #3 ensures invariant regs with respect to current loop can be combined together in LSR codegen. This invariant can be temporarily broken while building a formula. However, every formula inserted into the <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-loopstrengthreduce-cpp-/lsrinstance">LSRInstance</a> must be in canonical form.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp/#l00502">502</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp">LoopStrengthReduce.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### HasBaseReg {#a5dd38ab56c263b0c9684cb7ad90a17b8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LoopStrengthReduce.cpp&#125;::Formula::HasBaseReg = false</>}>

</MemberDefinition>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp/#l00506">506</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp">LoopStrengthReduce.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### UnfoldedOffset {#a12e25533d4ccb07257ed404f527196b3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Immediate anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;LoopStrengthReduce.cpp&#125;::Formula::UnfoldedOffset = <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-loopstrengthreduce-cpp-/immediate/#a393faf261b99c7234b6d7d97dbdbd5e0">Immediate::getZero</a>()</>}>
An additional constant offset which added near the use.

This requires a temporary register, but the offset itself can live in an add immediate field rather than a register.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp/#l00511">511</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp">LoopStrengthReduce.cpp</a>.
